intro: Argostemma uniflorum var. curtum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
